newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-KASPARKOVA WINS TRIPLE GOLD WITH PENULTIMATE LEAP.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-KASPARKOVA WINS TRIPLE GOLD WITH PENULTIMATE LEAP.

text.p: Czech Sarka Kasparkova won the world's women triple jump gold medal on Monday with 15.20 metres at her penultimate attempt.
Kasparkova, who had a modest personal best of 14.98 before the championships, used the third longest jump in the fledgling history of the sport to win her first major title.

Rodica Mateescu of Romania, who led the event until Kasparkova's winning leap with a mark of 15.16 metres set at her first try, had to settle for silver. Ukrainian Yelena Govorova took bronze with 14,67 metres,
World and Olympic champion Inessa Kravets of Ukraine, who is also the world record holder, did not turn up to the qualifying rounds on Saturday.
